name: Factoring Quadratics
latex: x^2 + bx + c = (x + p)(x + q) \text{ where } p + q = b \text{ and } pq = c
explanation: Factoring is the process of writing a polynomial as a product of simpler polynomials. For quadratics, we look for two numbers that add to the coefficient of x and multiply to the constant term. Factoring is useful for solving equations, as if (x + p)(x + q) = 0, then x = -p or x = -q.

proof: Factoring reverses multiplication. For ax² + bx + c, find two numbers p and q such that p + q = b and pq = ac. Then factor as (ax + p)(ax + q)/a. This works because (ax + p)(ax + q) = a²x² + a(p+q)x + pq = a²x² + abx + ac, dividing by a gives original.
